intro: Mendoncia mollis, commonly known as the soft mendoncia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated by gardeners interested in native or unusual flora.
